articles.title: New York City paralyzed by 6 inches of snow
articles.description: Heavy, wet snow brought New York City streets to a standstill Thursday. The conditions were caught on camera and posted by frustrated New Yorkers who had a blizzard of complaints. CBS News national correspondent Michelle Miller reports.

articles.title: Trump says he answered written questions from Mueller "very easily"
articles.description: After nearly a year of negotiations and misgivings, President Trump said Friday that he has answered written questions from special counsel Robert Mueller. He said he hasn't submitted them. CBS News chief White House correspondent Major Garrett reports.

articles.title: Search for missing in California blaze has become a monumental task
articles.description: The Camp Fire in California has taken a staggering toll. At least 63 people are dead and more than 630 are unaccounted for. CBS News correspondent DeMarco Morgan has the latest.

articles.title: Stacey Abrams acknowledges she won't win Georgia governor's race
articles.description: Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams, a Democrat, acknowledged Friday that Republican Brian Kemp will win the election. In a brief address, she said she would file a federal lawsuit over mismanagement of the election.

articles.title: "Toxic" named word of the year by Oxford English Dictionary
articles.description: A video posted to the Oxford Dictionary's Twitter account explains "this year more than ever, people have been using 'toxic' to describe a vast array of things, situations, concerns and events."

articles.title: Part of migrant caravan reaches U.S.-Mexico border
articles.description: Thousands of migrants are making their way to the United States through Mexico, and some of them have already reached the southern border in Tijuana. CBS News correspondent John Blackstone spoke to them as they tried to enter the U.S.

articles.title: "Batkid" in California declared cancer-free
articles.description: Five years ago, a cancer patient named Miles Scott dressed up as Bat Man -- and was treated to a special day in San Francisco. He's now 10 and has leukemia has been in remission for years and is now cancer free.

articles.title: Comedian tells the history of stand-up: Sex jokes always work
articles.description: This week on "The Takeout," CBS News' Major Garrett interviews political satirist Will Durst over lunch in New York City.

articles.title: FDA moves to ban menthol cigarettes, restrict e-cigarettes
articles.description: The FDA has proposed new rules that would ban menthol cigarettes and place additional restrictions on the sale of e-cigarettes. Dr. Jon LaPook joined CBSN to discuss what next steps may look like.

articles.title: Cindy McCain shares her feelings about President Trump
articles.description: Sen. John McCain's widow sat down with "CBS This Morning" co-host John Dickerson in her first interview since her husband's death. They discussed President Trump, who was often at odds with her late husband.

articles.title: Florida families still sleeping in tents weeks after Hurricane Michael
articles.description: It's been more than five weeks since Hurricane Michael slammed the Florida Panhandle. But in Panama City, there are still giant piles of debris and families are left sleeping in tents. CBS News correspondent Omar Villafranca reports.

articles.title: Fallen sergeant killed in the line of duty honored by fellow officers

articles.title: Homeless man and New Jersey couple accused of plotting GoFundMe scam
articles.description: A New Jersey couple gained headlines for sharing a story about a homeless man coming to their rescue. They set up a GoFundMe campaign for the man, but now prosecutors say it was all a scam. CBS News correspondent Meg Oliver explains.

articles.title: Veterans Affairs under fire for delayed GI Bill payments for veterans
articles.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs said Thursday it's trying to speed up benefits payments to thousands of veterans who are struggling to cover their education and housing bills. The delays are being blamed on IT issues. CBS News national correspondent Chip R…

articles.title: U.S. slaps sanctions on Saudis accused of taking part in death of journalist
articles.description: The U.S. slapped economic sanctions on 17 Saudis accused of taking part in the killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi. A Saudi prosecutor said he will seek the death penalty against five suspects. CBS News foreign correspondent Holly Williams r…

articles.title: FDA seeks nationwide ban on menthol cigarettes
articles.description: The Food and Drug Administration said it will seek a nationwide ban on menthol cigarettes. It also plans to put new restrictions on flavored e-cigarettes. CBS News chief medical correspondent Dr. Jon LaPook explains.
